intro: Ribes huronense, commonly known as Huron gooseberry, is a species of shrub native to the Great Lakes region of North America. It belongs to the Grossulariaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dark green, lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green berries that are typically edible but have a tart flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
